remixlab.proscene
Class HIDevice

java.lang.Object
  remixlab.proscene.HIDevice

public class HIDevice
extends java.lang.Object

An HIDevice represents a Human Interface Device with (<=) 6 degrees of freedom.

An HIDevice has a type which can be RELATIVE (default) or ABSOLUTE. A RELATIVE HIDevice has a neutral position that the device holds when it is not being manipulated. An ABSOLUTE HIDevice has no such neutral position. Examples of RELATIVE devices are the space navigator and the joystick, examples of ABSOLUTE devices are the wii or the kinect.

Nested Class Summary

          This enum holds the camera modes predefined by an HIDevice.

          This enum holds the interactive frame manipulation modes predefined by an HIDevice.

          This enum holds the device type.

Method Detail

feed

public void feed(float tx,
                 float ty,
                 float tz,
                 float rx,
                 float ry,
                 float rz)
Feed the HIDevice with hardware output using a controller. The controller should be implemented by the application. This method simply calls feedTranslation(tx,ty,tz) and feedRotation(rx,ry,rz).

Useful when addHandler(Object, String) has been called on this HIDevice.

See Also:
feedTranslation(float, float, float), feedRotation(float, float, float)

feedTranslation

public void feedTranslation(float x,
                            float y,
                            float z)
Defines the device translation feed.

Useful when addHandler(Object, String) has been called on this HIDevice.

Parameters:
x - x-axis translation
y - y-axis translation
z - z-axis translation
See Also:
feed(float, float, float, float, float, float), feedRotation(float, float, float)

feedXTranslation

public float feedXTranslation()
Overload this method to define the x-axis translation feed this method if you plan to implement your own HIDevice. Otherwise use feedXTranslation(float) and addHandler(Object, String) to the HIDevice.

addHandler

public void addHandler(java.lang.Object obj,
                       java.lang.String methodName)
Attempt to add a 'feed' handler method to the HIDevice. The default feed handler is a method that returns void and has one single HIDevice parameter.

Parameters:
obj - the object to handle the feed
methodName - the method to execute the feed in the object handler class
See Also:
removeHandler()

removeHandler

public void removeHandler()
Unregisters the 'feed' handler method (if any has previously been added to the HIDevice).

See Also:
addHandler(Object, String)

customCameraHandle

protected void customCameraHandle()
Overload this method in your HIDevice derived class if you plan to define your own camera handle method. Default implementation is empty.

customIFrameHandle

protected void customIFrameHandle()
Overload this method in your HIDevice derived class if you plan to define your own interactive frame handle method. Default implementation is empty.
